page.title: 01RESUME
page.content: {RESUME} The area covers a nucleated market-town-like settlement known as the village of Chulmleigh (pronounced Chum-ley) in the SW grid square of the area studied. Chulmleigh is on the south facing slope of the 200 metre plateau incised by the River Little Dart. Pastural farmland with copses make up the other eleven grid squares. See first paragraph of FARMING. {GENERAL REVUEW} An undulating area with the main drainage flowing W or SW towards the river Little Dart. This river approximately parallel to and within one half kilometre of the S boundary of the area studied - Easting 14 on the OS 1:25000 Map Sheet SS61/71 - is the prime physical reason for the settlement, situated as it is, entirely on its south facing side. From which Dartmoor can be seen on a clear day. Incidentally, it was from
